intro: Spermacoce fastigiata, commonly known as the upright spurge or slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive spherical, yellowish berries. Spermacoce fastigiata is often found in coastal areas, disturbed soils, and along roadsides, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
